label: A rdfs:label
definition: AL definition@en SPLIT=|
target of administration: C 'realizes' some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some %)) SPLIT=|
material administered: C 'realizes' some ('material to be added role' and ('role of' some %)) SPLIT=|

label: intraperitoneal injection
definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the peritoneum (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

label: intraperitoneal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the peritoneum of an organism
example of usage: Rats were injected intraperitoneally with either rrIL-6 (250 ng/0.5 ml) or equal-volume sterile saline twice within an interval of 24 h

label: oral ingestion of pill
definition: An adding a material entity to target with the entity is a pill and the target is the mouth

label: intramuscular injection
definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the muscle (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

label: intradermal injection
definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the dermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

label: oral administration
definition: An administering substance in vivo into the mouth of an organism

label: subcutaneous injection
definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the hypodermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

label: intranasal mucosal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the intranasal mucosis of an organism

label: intravenous injection
definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the vein (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

label: passive immunization
definition: The injection of immune effector material (antibodies, T cells or B cells) into an organism so that the organisms immune system gains its  immune effector function to recognize specific antigens.
example of usage: Giving VIG (concentrated antibodies from vaccinated donors) to a patient that is infected with smallpox. Transferring epitope specific T cells from one mouse into another.
term editor: PERSON: Bjoern Peters, Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum

label: antibiotic administration process
definition: Administering substance in vivo where an antibiotic substance is administered to a living organism.

label: administering substance in vivo to cause disease
definition: An administration of substance in vivo with the intention to induce disease in the organism.

label: administering substance in vivo to reduce or prevent disease
definition: An administration of substance in vivo with the intention to reduce the symptoms of or prevent development of a disease in the organism.
objective: ('disease prevalence reduction objective' or 'disease severity reduction objective' or 'disease prevention objective')

label: in vivo challenge
definition: The administration of a challenge to a live host.

label: intragastric administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the stomach of an organism.

label: intracolonic administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the colon of an organism.

label: vaginal administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the vagina of an organism.

label: topical administration
definition: An administration of a substance onto the surface of the skin of an organism.

label: cervical administration
definition: An administration of a substance to the cervix of an organism.

label: conjunctival administration
definition: An administration of a substance to the conjunctiva of an organism.

label: intratracheal administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the trachea of an organism.

label: intra-amniotic administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the amnion of an organism.

label: intra-arterial administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the artery of an organism.

label: intracerebral administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the cerebrum of an organism.

label: intracranial administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the cranium of an organism.

label: intraepidermal administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the epidermis of an organism.

label: intralymphatic administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the lymphatic system of an organism.

label: lymph node administration
definition: An intralymphatic administration in which the substance is administered into a lymph node.

label: urethral administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the urethra of an organism.

label: skin scarification administration
definition: An intraepidermal administration in which the skin is scratched before the substance is administered to the skin.

label: intrauteral administration
definition: An adminstration of a substance into the uterus of an organism.

label: intracarotid administration
definition: An intra-arterial administration in which the substance is administered into the carotid artery.

label: intraocular administration
definition: An administration of a substance to the eye of an organism.

label: intraplacental administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the placenta of an organism.

label: intrarectal administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the rectum of an organism.

label: intrasplenic administration
definition: An administration of a substance into the spleen of an organism.

label: intratumoral administration
definition: An administration of a substance into a tumor of an organism.

label: administration in vivo with infectious agent
editor preferred term: administration in vivo with infectious agent
definition: is an administration of an infectious agent to a host organism
